title: NeuralDynamics - A neuro-dynamic framework for cognitive robotics: Autonomous generation of scene representations and behavioral sequences using online learning

author: Gregor Schöner, Institut für Neuroinformatik, Ruhr University Bochum

segmentation: It's my pleasure to present briefly the Neural Dynamics project.
There's a web page where you can read up on all of that you it's very.

It's really our acronym DOT EU, the long title of the project is a neurodynamic framework for cognitive robotics, autonomous generation of scene representations, and behavioral sequences using online learning.
I'm reading that title because that's really the program statement of our project.
And I give you a brief summary here.
So if you lose me, that's really the take home message.

Our goal is to look at the problems of scene representation, object representation on the one hand, perceptually, and to look at behavioral sequence generation behavioral in on the action side as two core problems of cognitive robotics, and to seek solutions to these problems based on analysis with human cognition and development of some quick mission.

And our basic hypothesis is that a particular language of neural dynamics, in particular through the form of dynamic field theory, that I'll briefly say what that is, provides the Lang and appropriate language to seek such solutions together with principles of learning.

Emphasis is to say there are these two bottleneck problems that we humans solve so well.

And then sequence generation or generation of meaningful behavior as the second.

Forms of cognition extension decision making perceptual motor working memory and many, many other things.
